title: Documents and bodycam footage for case BA490599

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all unedited/unredacted (if possible) bodycam footage and 911 calls related to the case of Daystar Peterson (BA490599). Please include transcripts of the calls and bodycam footage if available. One particular call is of great public interest: the call from Sean Kelly, the only independent eyewitness in this case. The public has not heard that call, nor have we seen the transcript of it. Other calls from witnesses who were not eyewitnesses have been released publicly. I would also like the original police reports associated with the case as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dana T.

title: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the agency’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
 The report should include data logged from the earliest date possible and to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the earliest date possible and to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of share settings that include:
3.1 The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."
3.2 The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."
3.3 The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists that I’m sharing."
3.4 The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists shared with me."

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

A

title: FBI RECORDS for Nazzareno MASECCHIA (AKA Reno)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please conduct a search for responsive records and hereby request the following:

Any and all records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into Nazzareno MASECCHIA (AKA RENO)

 Nazzareno MASECCHIA's date of death was November 30, 2011. Have attached a picture of his obituary in Legacy in The Buffalo News published December  4 and 5, 2011.  Here is the linK: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/nazzareno-masecchia-obituary?id=4766717

Please include any and all surveillance pictures Nazzareno and charts  referring to him.  

1. The Nazzareno Family was close to the Mazzara Family so please include any and all references to BARTHOLOMEW T MAZZARA a made man in the Buffalo LCN family and his daughter Krista married Nazzareno's son Michael Masecchia.  Bart's DOB: 1/17/1941. See: https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112825753/bart-t-mazzara ....Bart's DOD: 10/25/2003. See: https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112825753/bart-t-mazzara

2. The Nazzareno Family was close to Frank "AKA Butchie BiFolcals" BiFulco who was Nazzareno's son Michael's godfather.  See attached screenshot of the Transcript of Ron Serio's Day 1 Testimony in the United States v. Bongiovanni (W.D.N.Y. 2019) Docket Number: 1:19-cr-00227 Date Filed: October 31st, 2019 Assigned To: Lawrence Joseph Vilardo. BiFulco was a prominent Buffalo LCN family member.  Bifulco's Date of Birth was 3/10/1945. Bifulco's Date of Death was 10/10/2020. See: https://buffalonews.com/obituaries/frank-butch-bifulco-75-reputed-mobster-with-a-brilliant-mind/article_1165f678-1ab8-11eb-a55c-130105cb65b9. See Also: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-frank-bifulco-obituary/165163991/

 Please include any and all references to Frank "Butchie" BiFulco. 

In addition to conducting this search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY, please conduct an additional search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. 

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mob
